TopicTitle: Tried to mod Jool to be solid so i can land on it, this happened...

Articles.Content:
So i modded Jool to be solid and i added a color map (it was just green Color), but instead it didn't use that color map, but it used a weird ground texture...

Javascript is disabled. View full album
That's pretty interesting. Either you found some hidden Jool ground texture of it is just some default thing added to all planets.

how did you mod that?

I used Kopernicus mod to edit jool (it's a planet making/editing mod).

Looks like the default Kerbin mountain texture.

Now go rescue him...
Next on the "to do list": SSTO Jool
If ever there were a place where a Monolith would be REALLY appropriate...

Back in the old days 0.18-0-19 you could "land" on Jool

Here Jeb is lowered down below an balloon to the surface, you could not land a ship or probe as you whould be thrown around a lot so it would be destroyed but kerbals was imune.

I was unable to plant an flag and filed an bug report, next version and jool had no bottom but is transparent.

And yes you have to rescue him. again in 0.9 it was posible to return from the "surface" in stock its not now, aerospikes has an isp of 70 or something, all other engines has 0 in mechjeb.

Nothing in KSP is as simple as it seems.

Even something as mundane as editing a save file with WordPad and deleting a part from a ship is complicated. You can't simply delete the PART block of the thing you want to delete. You have to look everywhere else in the ship's code block and delete all the connections other parts have to the part you deleted. If you don't, the game will glitch in completely unexpected ways (for me, deleting a part by merely erasing the PART block caused the staging diagram to glitch and start showing undefined "null" parts, and also caused the entire surface of Minmus to disappear whenever the modified ship was the one being "flown").

Nothing in KSP is as simple as it seems.

Even something as mundane as editing a save file with WordPad and deleting a part from a ship is complicated. You can't simply delete the PART block of the thing you want to delete. You have to look everywhere else in the ship's code block and delete all the connections other parts have to the part you deleted. If you don't, the game will glitch in completely unexpected ways (for me, deleting a part by merely erasing the PART block caused the staging diagram to glitch and start showing undefined "null" parts, and also caused the entire surface of Minmus to disappear whenever the modified ship was the one being "flown").

That's what you call a working anti-cheat system, right?
